Called the Art Fund for Young Curators (AFY), the program will provide $750,000 over three years to help budding collectors through the art world’s changes.“ICA is committed to advancing the art of the 21st Century through a new generation of curators, whose passion and commitment is driving the next generation of artists, creators, and thinkers,” said ICA director and CEO Cat Staggs. “With the advent of digital and social media, the future of art and innovation is at stake. The Food & Wine Symposium and the Art of Technology symposia are both crucial venues for young curators to be inspired by the art of tomorrow. The AFY program will deliver funding and mentoring towards these young curators and will help them prepare for the 2019 and 2020 seasons.”The Summer School will be hosted at the British Council’s headquarters in London and will focus on an exhibition of work by artists whose work is currently on view in the Summer Schools.
